page.title: 13BUNNY VILLAGE GREEN SAVED!
page.content: In June 1984 the{Nottinghamshire {County Council}decided to sell off the {land}in front of{Bunny School.}The{PTA and the people of Bunny and Bradmore were angry that their village open space would disappear. A petition was signed by the parents and teachers. {Parents and children}went to County Hall with a protest banner when the final decision to sell the land was to be made. A photograph and an article appeared in the{Nottingham Evening {Post.}The{headteacher}wrote to Kenneth Clarke the{M.P. for Rushcliffe}and many other important people. The Bunny school{governors}and the Bunny Parish Council tried to stop the sale. Finally the Council agreed to sell the land to{Bunny Parish Council}for Â£3000 so that it would not be built upon. Now Bunny has its own village green which is safe for all time.
